Class algorithms

java.lang.Object
algorithms
public class algorithms extends Object
A class for the algorithm function of the application

      public algorithms()

  • Method Details

    • algorithm

      public static void algorithm()
      A function that takes an input within the range of 1000 and 10000 from the user. And creates an array with user's input as it's size. In the end compares 5 different sorting algorithms.

    • print

      static void print(int[] arr, int n)
      A function to print an array
      Parameters:
      arr - an array to print
      n - size of the array

    • print

      static void print(List<Integer> arr, int n)
      A function to print a list
      Parameters:
      arr - a list to print
      n - size of the list

    • swap

      public static void swap(int[] arr, int i, int j)
      A function to swap two indices of an array
      Parameters:
      arr - an array to swap it's indices
      i - first index to swap
      j - second index to swap

    • copyArray

      public static void copyArray(List<Integer> arr1, int[] arr2)
      A function to copy a list into an array
      Parameters:
      arr1 - the list to copy
      arr2 - the array to use as the duplicate

    • isArraySame

      public static boolean isArraySame(int[] arr, List<Integer> list)
      A function to check if an array and a list are equal
      Parameters:
      arr - the array to compare
      list - the list to compare
      Returns:
      true if arrays are the same, false if they are different

    • toInt

      public static int toInt(String input)
      A function to transform a string into an integer
      Parameters:
      input - the string to transform
      Returns:
      integer version of the given string

    • digit

      public static int digit(int value, int digit)
      A function to calculate the value of a number at a specific digit position by multiplying it by 10 raised to the given digit.
      Parameters:
      value - the base number to be shifted
      digit - the number of places to shift (1 for tens, 2 for hundreds, etc.)
      Returns:
      the shifted value corresponding to the specified digit position

    • getMax

      static int getMax(int[] arr, int n)
      A function to get the number with maximum amount of digits from an array
      Parameters:
      arr - an array to find the number with maximum amount of digits
      n - size of the array
      Returns:
      the number with maximum amount of digits

    • countSort

      static void countSort(int[] arr, int n, int digit)
      A function that sorts an array using count sort algorithm for each digit
      Parameters:
      arr - an array to sort
      n - the size of the array
      digit - the digit to sort for

    • radixsort

      static void radixsort(int[] arr, int n)
      A function that sorts an array using radix sort algorithm
      Parameters:
      arr - an array to sort
      n - the size of the array

      n - the size of the array
